text: [Music]
my name is leo lebranch i'm a director
of global strategic initiatives focused
in the partner organization
i didn't actually apply to amazon to
begin with it actually wasn't until i
had dinner with some former colleagues
of mine who are now amazon employees who
really helped me understand
amazon's culture in particular so the
two questions i asked them were
why would i consider them and the other
one was why would they consider me and
the answers they gave me really were
what led me here so the first was
why would they consider me and the
answer i received which i still believe
is true today is
amazon cares a lot more about the why
and how you've done things than they do
about the what right the what gets you
in the door but how you've done it and
why you did it and sort of the thought
process and fundamentally the leadership
principles underneath underpinning that
were why they would consider you and
then when they when i asked why i should
consider them
they said because we know you
we know how you work we know how you
operate i'm very much a
entrepreneur or entrepreneur in the case
of large businesses right i want to go
after
a very large scale opportunities that no
one else is doing and other large
organizations in this particular
industry are not nearly as flexible when
it comes to really driving big ideas
that aren't being done
i originally interviewed for a role that
has nothing to do with what i'm doing
now um i was
interviewing to be a director of product
management in the iot space and they
said no
but they didn't say no entirely what
they said was we think culturally you
fit here very well
but we actually have a much bigger or
more appropriate need way on the other
side of the business around large-scale
enterprise customers and enterprise
partners
so greatest accomplishments in that vein
and actually the reason i have the job i
have now
is i've taken six different large-scale
sort of think big ideas all of them have
been approved right and so i started to
build
additional businesses in addition my day
job to the point that they said stop
doing your day job
right so so i've now moved and actually
this is very common i've seen within
amazon where people effectively are
creating their next career
path
[Music]
coming here
the framework that the leadership
principles provide really
enables a
freedom that i hadn't found anywhere
else
you know the fact that we're allowed to
run our businesses largely independently
as long as we're operating within the
framework that the lps provide means you
have a lot of freedom to invent and a
lot of freedom to experiment so
it's very common within my business for
us to be running three four five ten
different experiments in pursuit of a
much bigger potential opportunity i
always tell people think really big and
experimentally
so if i'm gonna go after a multi-billion
dollar business what are the finite
tangible measurable experiments we can
run that doesn't require massive
investment so we can prove hey there's
this theory that hypothesis actually
worked right a lot of times it kind of
takes me back to high school science in
a way where what's my hypothesis what
are the dimensions of that how do i test
it what sort of investment do i need etc
we're doing that constantly right and so
yes i've got a day job but really what i
find the most fun and what i spend the
most time on these experiments
